intro: Maytenus boaria var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mayten, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 5 cm in width. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange or red berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed or secondary forest areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical research.
